page.description: The Not Exactly Matching operator returns .T. (TRUE) if the expressions on both sides of the operator both, Operand1 and Operand2, are of different types or have different values. If two character strings have different characters, different case, or a different number of trailing blanks, then Not Exactly Matching operator will return .T. (TRUE). The opposite of "!=" is "==" ( Exactly Matching Operator ). Note : When comparing a character field to a string, remember that the length of the field is pre-defined. If the field is assigned fewer characters than its defined length, the remainder of the field is padded with spaces. The Not Exactly Matching operator does not automatically remove trailing blanks.
page.syntax: Result as L = Operand1 as A != Operand2 as A

argument.name: Operand1
argument.description: A value or expression of any type.

argument.name: Operand2
argument.description: A value or expression of any type.

section.title: Examples:
section.description: Since the number of trailing blanks are different
Since the case of the characters does not match
Since the blanks at the end of the strings are not trimmed
